intro: Lycianthes recticarpa, commonly known as the prickly morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes and potatoes, and is characterized by its hairy, spiny stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that give way to bright orange, fleshy berries. Its fruits are edible when ripe but contain seeds that are often dispersed by animals. Lycianthes recticarpa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and unique growth habits.
